===400V-DC rated connectors===
===400V-DC rated connectors===
â
[[File:Powerpole.JPG|thumb]]
+
[[File:Powerpole.JPG|thumb|{{deletable image-caption|Tuesday, 21 June 2011}}]]
Buildings such as [[data centre]]s are starting to be designed for 380V-DC power distribution as a way of improving electrical efficiency<ref>{{cite web|title=Researchers Flip the Switch to Test Energy Saving in Data Centers Using DC Power Directly|url=http://www.calit2.net/newsroom/release.php?id=1730|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>. DC power distribution has resulted in the need to standardise a [[Low Voltage]] (LV) connector with an integral ground conductor, and that is safe for use by untrained personnel. The tendency of LV connectors to arc when disconnected from a capacitive load requires the connector's insulation to contain the [[Plasma (physics)|plasma]] arc in addition to normal requirements such as preventing accidental finger contact. Examples are the Anderson PowerpoleÂ® Pak connectors <ref>{{cite web|title=PowerpoleÂ® Pak Connectors|url=http://andersonpower.com/products/powerpak-powerpole-pak.html|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref> and SDG connector<ref>{{cite web|title=Saf-D-GridÂ® Connector|url=http://www.andersonpower.com/products/sdg.html|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>, designed with the form factor of an [[IEC_60320_C15#C15.2FC16_coupler|IEC C15]] connector.
Buildings such as [[data centre]]s are starting to be designed for 380V-DC power distribution as a way of improving electrical efficiency<ref>{{cite web|title=Researchers Flip the Switch to Test Energy Saving in Data Centers Using DC Power Directly|url=http://www.calit2.net/newsroom/release.php?id=1730|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>. DC power distribution has resulted in the need to standardise a [[Low Voltage]] (LV) connector with an integral ground conductor, and that is safe for use by untrained personnel. The tendency of LV connectors to arc when disconnected from a capacitive load requires the connector's insulation to contain the [[Plasma (physics)|plasma]] arc in addition to normal requirements such as preventing accidental finger contact. Examples are the Anderson PowerpoleÂ® Pak connectors <ref>{{cite web|title=PowerpoleÂ® Pak Connectors|url=http://andersonpower.com/products/powerpak-powerpole-pak.html|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref> and SDG connector<ref>{{cite web|title=Saf-D-GridÂ® Connector|url=http://www.andersonpower.com/products/sdg.html|publisher=Anderson Power Products Inc|accessdate=16 June 2011}}</ref>, designed with the form factor of an [[IEC_60320_C15#C15.2FC16_coupler|IEC C15]] connector.
